deck.name: GCP PCA - Migration
deck.description: Migration strategies, tools และ best practices สำหรับ GCP Professional Cloud Architect

cards.vocab: What are the cloud migration strategies (6 Rs)?
cards.meaning: Cloud migration strategies (6 Rs) มีอะไรบ้าง?
cards.example: The 6 Rs: 1) Rehost (Lift-and-shift): Move as-is to cloud VMs. Fastest, minimal changes, limited cloud benefits. 2) Replatform (Lift-and-reshape): Minor optimizations. Example: Move to managed database. 3) Repurchase: Replace with SaaS. Example: On-prem CRM → Salesforce. 4) Refactor/Re-architect: Redesign for cloud-native. Most effort, most benefits. 5) Retire: Decommission unused apps. 6) Retain: Keep on-premises (not suitable for cloud). Decision factors: Time, cost, team skills, app criticality, technical debt. Typical journey: Rehost first (quick wins), then replatform/refactor strategic apps. Exam tip: Know when each strategy is appropriate, trade-offs of each.

cards.vocab: What is Migrate for Compute Engine?
cards.meaning: Migrate for Compute Engine คืออะไร?
cards.example: Migrate for Compute Engine: Tool for migrating VMs to GCP. Sources: VMware, AWS, Azure, physical servers. Features: 1) Continuous replication: Minimal downtime. 2) Test clones: Validate before cutover. 3) Waves: Group VMs for batch migration. 4) Automatic adaptation: Adjust for GCP (drivers, etc.). Process: 1) Install Migrate connector at source. 2) Discover and assess VMs. 3) Configure replication. 4) Create test clones, validate. 5) Cutover (short downtime). Best practices: 1) Assess before migrating (fit-assessment). 2) Start with non-critical workloads. 3) Test thoroughly before cutover. 4) Plan network connectivity first. Exam tip: Know migration phases, test clones capability, continuous replication.

cards.meaning: Migrate for Anthos/Containers คืออะไร?
cards.example: Migrate for Containers: Modernize VMs to containers. Sources: VMware VMs, Compute Engine VMs, AWS VMs. Process: 1) Discover and assess workloads. 2) Generate migration plan. 3) Extract container artifacts. 4) Generate Kubernetes manifests. 5) Deploy to GKE or Cloud Run. Fit assessment: Identifies VM suitability for containerization. Artifacts generated: 1) Dockerfile. 2) Container image. 3) Kubernetes deployment YAML. 4) Service YAML. Benefits: 1) No code changes required. 2) Automated containerization. 3) Path to cloud-native. 4) Supports stateless and stateful apps. Limitations: Not all apps suitable (Windows limitations, kernel dependencies). Exam tip: Know when Migrate for Containers is appropriate vs manual containerization.

cards.vocab: How do you migrate databases to GCP?
cards.meaning: Migrate databases ไป GCP อย่างไร?
cards.example: Database Migration Service (DMS): Managed service for database migration. Supported: MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server → Cloud SQL, AlloyDB. Oracle → Bare Metal Solution. Features: 1) Continuous replication (CDC). 2) Minimal downtime. 3) Serverless (no infrastructure). Process: 1) Create connection profiles (source, destination). 2) Create migration job. 3) Initial load + continuous replication. 4) Validate data. 5) Promote destination (cutover). Heterogeneous migrations: Different database types. Use: Striim, Datastream, custom ETL. BigQuery migration: Transfer Service for data warehouses (Teradata, Redshift). Best practices: 1) Assess schema compatibility. 2) Test with production-like data. 3) Plan for application connection string updates. 4) Have rollback plan. Exam tip: Know DMS capabilities, homogeneous vs heterogeneous migrations.

cards.vocab: How do you migrate data to Cloud Storage?
cards.meaning: Migrate data ไป Cloud Storage อย่างไร?
cards.example: Migration methods: 1) gsutil: Command-line, good for <1TB, parallel upload. 2) Storage Transfer Service: Managed, from S3/Azure/HTTP/other GCS. Scheduled, incremental. 3) Transfer Appliance: Physical device for large data (100TB-1PB). Ship to Google for upload. 4) BigQuery Data Transfer Service: For data warehouse sources. Decision factors: Data volume, network bandwidth, time constraints. gsutil: Small data, good connectivity. Storage Transfer Service: Cloud-to-cloud, ongoing sync, large data with good bandwidth. Transfer Appliance: Massive data (petabytes), limited bandwidth, one-time. Time estimates: 1Gbps network = ~10TB/day. Transfer Appliance = ship + upload time. Exam tip: Know when to use each method based on data size and bandwidth.

cards.vocab: How do you plan a migration project?
cards.meaning: วางแผน migration project อย่างไร?
cards.example: Migration phases: 1) Assess: Inventory apps, dependencies, requirements. Tools: CAST, Stratozone, manual discovery. 2) Plan: Define waves, target architecture, timeline. 3) Deploy: Build landing zone (VPC, IAM, security). 4) Migrate: Execute migration per wave. 5) Optimize: Right-size, modernize, cost optimize. Landing zone: Foundation infrastructure. Components: Org structure, VPCs, IAM, security policies, logging. Wave planning: Group apps by: Dependencies, criticality, complexity. Start with: Low-risk, independent apps. Move to: Business-critical apps. Change management: 1) Application connection string updates. 2) DNS changes. 3) User training. 4) Runbook documentation. Exam tip: Know migration phases, landing zone components, wave planning criteria.
